intro: Cryptocarya longistyla, commonly known as the longstyle cryptocarya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in coastal and lowland forest habitats. Its leaves are elliptical, leathery, and have a fragrant aroma, while its flowers are small and clustered in umbels. Cryptocarya longistyla plays a role in local ecosystems and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance.
